title: Watering
description: Water your plants 2-3 times a week depending on the season. Avoid overwatering to prevent root rot.

title: Sunlight
description: Place indoor plants near windows for indirect sunlight. Some plants prefer low light areas.

title: Fertilizing
description: Use natural fertilizer once a month for healthy growth. Avoid excess fertilizer as it may burn the roots.

title: Pruning
description: Trim dead leaves and stems regularly to encourage healthy new growth.

title: Repotting
description: Repot plants every 1-2 years to provide fresh soil and more space for roots.

title: Humidity
description: Maintain moderate humidity for tropical plants. Use a humidifier or mist the leaves occasionally.

title: Pest Control
description: Inspect plants regularly for pests like aphids or spider mites and treat with natural solutions if needed.

title: Cleaning Leaves
description: Wipe leaves with a damp cloth to remove dust, which improves photosynthesis and keeps plants healthy.

title: Soil Choice
description: Use well-draining soil suitable for each plant type to prevent root rot and promote growth.
